title: ORSA Final Transmission
author: ORSA Emergency System
pages:
AUTOMATED EMERGENCY
BROADCAST

ORSA EMERGENCY SYSTEM
TRANSMISSION ID: FINAL

All facilities abandoned.
All personnel evacuated or
unaccounted for.

This is an automated message.

ORBITAL STATUS:

Eccentricity: CRITICAL
Semi-major axis: ~2.3 AU
Rate of change: +0.01 AU/yr

Projected surface equilibrium
temperature: -140C

Timeline to equilibrium:
Unknown. Decades. Maybe less.

SURVIVAL ADVISORY:

Surface habitation is no
longer viable.

Only viable habitat: deep
underground. Geothermal
energy provides residual
warmth independent of
solar input.

RELAY SATELLITE STATUS:

Project Lighthouse: ACTIVE
Satellites responding: 3/7
Mode: Passive listening
Frequency: Deep-band

Awaiting surface transponder
signal.

No signal detected.

FINAL DIRECTIVE:

Go deep.
Stay warm.

If you find the transponder
schematics, build it.
The satellites are listening.

There may still be a way
off this rock.

This message repeats.
